results.title: From forest to timber yard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Film opens with a short description, aided by diagrams, of the structure of hard and soft woods followed by a demonstration on the correct way of felling trees, cutting the logs into boards and stacking to dry. The film concludes by listing the woods suitable for different types of work, eg oak and mahogany for cabinet making; pine and fir for carpentry; ash and elm for the wheelwright; and lime and maple for carving.

results.title: Crossbanding and jointing veneers
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Both sides of the wood are veneered to prevent warping. The method of making this is demonstrated through an example of a door made of laminated wood. It is explained how to veneer the face of the door to match the edges and when a piece of veneer is not wide enough to cover a surface, how a joint must be made.

results.title: Care of saws
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Shows how saws are made and then describes in detail the reconditioning and general care of saws. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic woodwork: Preparing the wood
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
After explaining the need for making a rough sketch and dimensional drawings of the article to be made, this film goes on to explain the drawing up of a cutting list of the sizes of the various pieces of wood required for the job.
